Key Match Events: India secured an unassailable 3-1 lead in the five-match series with a 10-wicket victory over Zimbabwe
Miscellaneous Highlights: This is the second time that India beat Zimbabwe by 10 wickets after a similar-margin win at the same venue in 2016
Others: Yashasvi Jaiswal's unbeaten 93-run knock and Shubman Gill's 58 not out guided India to a 153-run chase in 15.2 overs
India’s part-time bowlers Shivam Dube and Abhishek Sharma performed commendably in the middle overs to restrict Zimbabwe to a manageable 152 for seven
Raza smashed 46 off 28 balls but India’s fifth bowler Abhishek (1/20 in 3 overs) and sixth option Dube (1/11 in 2 overs) produced a decent effort to keep the proceedings under control
Madhevere and Marumani added 63 in a solid opening stand
Left-arm spinner Abhishek forced Marumani to mistime a pull-shot into Rinku Singh’s hands
Rinku at deep mid-wicket completed formality
Brian Bennett (9 off 14 balls), who was brilliant with the bat in the second game failed to get going before Washington sent him back
